Header: Reuters journalists jailed in Myanmar over secrets act
Content: A court in Myanmar has sentenced two Reuters journalists to seven years in prison for violating a state secrets act while investigating violence against Rohingyas. Wa Lone and Kyaw Soe Oo were arrested while carrying official documents which had just been given to them by police officers. They have maintained their innocence, saying they were set up by police. The case has been widely seen as a test of press freedom in Myanmar. The two men, who both have families with young children, have been in prison since their arrest in December 2017.
